docs.abstract: The showrunners say they’ve heard and responded to criticism of “Game of Thrones,” but some say that has made the new show boring.
docs.snippet: The showrunners say they’ve heard and responded to criticism of “Game of Thrones,” but some say that has made the new show boring.
docs.lead_paragraph: In HBO’s new hit show “House of the Dragon,” the dragons are bigger, scalier and fire-breathier than they ever were in the network’s culture-changing fantasy epic, “Game of Thrones.” The casual misogyny and disturbing racial tropes of the first series have, however, been turned down a notch.

headline.main: ‘House of the Dragon’ Is Less Sexist and Racist. But Is It Good?

docs.abstract: Midterm election efforts by Crime Survivors for Safety and Justice will focus on states including Florida, Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Texas.
docs.snippet: Midterm election efforts by Crime Survivors for Safety and Justice will focus on states including Florida, Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania and Texas.
docs.lead_paragraph: Crime is a perennial political football, discussed on the campaign trail usually in terms of how harshly it should be punished. Voters describe how much they fear it. Candidates describe how tough they will be in stopping it.

headline.main: Nonprofit Aims to Persuade 100,000 Crime Survivors to Vote

docs.abstract: During a taping of the Comedy Central program Thursday night, he noted that it has been seven years since he replaced Jon Stewart. He will depart at a time to be determined, he said.
docs.snippet: During a taping of the Comedy Central program Thursday night, he noted that it has been seven years since he replaced Jon Stewart. He will depart at a time to be determined, he said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Trevor Noah, the South African comedian who took over the hosting reins of “The Daily Show” after the departure of Jon Stewart seven years ago, announced on Thursday that he would be leaving the program.

headline.main: Trevor Noah Announces He Will Leave ‘The Daily Show’

docs.abstract: Our democracy sprouts in the nursery of public schools — where students grapple, together, with our messy history and learn to negotiate differences.
docs.snippet: Our democracy sprouts in the nursery of public schools — where students grapple, together, with our messy history and learn to negotiate differences.
docs.lead_paragraph: For the majority of human history, most people didn’t go to school. Formal education was a privilege for the Alexander the Greats of the world, who could hire Aristotles as private tutors.

docs.abstract: Everett Long Jr. and Fred Smith Jr. marvel at the fact that, as two queer men, they met at what Mr. Long called one of the “most masculine and most beloved institutions of the Black community.”
docs.snippet: Everett Long Jr. and Fred Smith Jr. marvel at the fact that, as two queer men, they met at what Mr. Long called one of the “most masculine and most beloved institutions of the Black community.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Growing up, barbershops were “a place of stress” for Everett Leroy Long Jr. “They’re super hyper masculine areas,” he said, that didn’t always make him feel at ease as a queer man.

headline.main: At the Barbershop, a Meet-Cute Mid Cut
headline.print_headline: At the Barbershop, a Meet-Cute Mid Cut

docs.abstract: The White House has pledged $60 billion to a cause Robert Bullard has championed since the late seventies. He wants guarantees that the money will end up in the right hands.
docs.snippet: The White House has pledged $60 billion to a cause Robert Bullard has championed since the late seventies. He wants guarantees that the money will end up in the right hands.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — He’s known as the father of environmental justice, but more than half a century ago he was just Bob Bullard from Elba, a flyspeck town deep in Alabama that didn’t pave roads, install sewers or put up streetlights in areas where Black families like his lived. His grandmother had a sixth grade education. His father was an electrician and plumber who for years couldn’t get licensed because of his race.

headline.main: At 75, the Father of Environmental Justice Meets the Moment
headline.print_headline: Father of Environmental Justice for Poor Meets the Moment

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: White House Council on Environmental Quality

docs.abstract: What happened when a superintendent in northern Michigan raised the issue of systemic racism?
docs.snippet: What happened when a superintendent in northern Michigan raised the issue of systemic racism?
docs.lead_paragraph: The Leelanau Peninsula looks, on a map of Michigan, like a thick pinky with a gnarled tip. In the northern reaches of the state, it lies between Lake Michigan and Grand Traverse Bay. It’s a place of cherry and plum orchards, long stretches of road bordered by forests and fields and monumental, surreal sand dunes.

headline.main: Daring to Speak Up About Race in a Divided School District

docs.abstract: Politicians, activists and entrepreneurs are trying to solve the city’s deep racial and economic divides — and their ambitions know few boundaries.
docs.snippet: Politicians, activists and entrepreneurs are trying to solve the city’s deep racial and economic divides — and their ambitions know few boundaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS — It’s called the Delmar Divide, named for the once-grand boulevard that bisects this city into enclaves that have long been more starkly segregated than almost anywhere else in America.

headline.main: Teddy Bears and Racial Justice: How St. Louis Became a Laboratory for Social Work

docs.abstract: As American feminists came together in 2017 to protest Donald Trump, Russia’s disinformation machine set about deepening the divides among them.
docs.snippet: As American feminists came together in 2017 to protest Donald Trump, Russia’s disinformation machine set about deepening the divides among them.
docs.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

headline.main: How Russian Trolls Helped Keep the Women’s March Out of Lock Step
headline.print_headline: Trolls in Russia Schemed To Divide Women’s March

docs.abstract: Andy Campbell details the history of an ascendant far-right group.
docs.snippet: Andy Campbell details the history of an ascendant far-right group.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like Donald Trump’s run for office, the Proud Boys evolved out of a TV show. A British-born Canadian named Gavin McInnes had long ranted against feminism, Black activism and political correctness on his online video series, and in 2016 saw the chance to draw his fans into a movement. According to “We Are Proud Boys,” Andy Campbell’s new history of the organization, McInnes began partying and soapboxing with followers of his show after tapings, promoting “Western chauvinist” values. What started as an all-male “drinking club with a patriotism problem” would soon become one of the most visible extremist groups in the United States, with thousands of members across more than 150 chapters.

headline.main: The Proud Boys and the Long-Lived Anxieties of American Men
